posts.title: Events Celebrating Asian American and Pacific Islander Heritage Month
posts.text: We invite you to join us in solidarity against racism and xenophobia and to celebrate the richness of the AAPI communities.

posts.title: #StopAsianHate: An Online Discussion & Books About the AAPI Experience
posts.text: Many in the AAPI community have been feeling sad, angry, fearful, or traumatized. On May 25, the Todt Hill-Westerleigh Library will host a discussion about Asian hate and hearing some of the lived experiences of Asian Americans and Pacific Islanders.

posts.title: Aging Creatively with Art for a Lifetime
posts.text: The New York Public Library is offering a unique opportunity for those 50 and older. Several neighborhood branches will be offering classes in a variety of art forms.

posts.title: NYPL's 2017 Make Music New York Lineup
posts.text: This year’s MMNY festival is taking place on Wednesday, June 21st aka the Summer Solstice. The New York Public Library will be hosting 20+ performances from classical to jazz to pop to kid-friendly rock concerts.

posts.title: #OneBookNY Events in Your Neighborhood
posts.text: The city's first One Book, One New York reading program is bringing book-lovers together to read Americanah by Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie. To celebrate throughout the summer, The New York Public Library will host a variety of events throughout the Bronx, Manhattan, and Staten Island.

posts.title: NYPL Makes Music with Make Music NY!
posts.text: On Tuesday, June 21—the Summer Solstice—the library will be hosting 30+ free music performances!

posts.title: Join the Gracie Book Club
posts.text: Join us for a discussion on Bright Lines at one of our local libraries.

posts.title: Subway Series at New York City Libraries This September
posts.text: It’s not often that you can see a Grammy Award-winning group perform live for free, right in your own neighborhood—so be sure to catch St. Luke’s Chamber Ensemble next month at your local library.
